meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fortuitous; fortuitousness.
meanings.sent1: The fortuity of finding a four-leaf clover brought her good luck.
meanings.sent2: The fortuity of meeting an old friend at the store made her day.
meanings.sent3: It was a fortuity that the rain stopped just in time for the outdoor wedding.
meanings.sent4: The fortuity of winning the lottery felt like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The fortuity of discovering a hidden talent can change one's life forever.

meanings.sent1: By sheer fortuity, they stumbled upon the buried treasure.
meanings.sent2: The fortuity of bumping into each other at the park was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent3: It was a fortuity that the dog found its way back home after getting lost.
meanings.sent4: The fortuity of the power outage saved them from a boring evening of TV.
meanings.sent5: The fortuity of finding a parking spot right in front of the restaurant was unbelievable.
